Zhu Yangzhu is the spaceflight engineer for the Shenzhou XVI mission ï¼ˆä½¿å‘½ï¼‰. He $\underline{ 1 }$ in love with the blue sky and flying at an early age. When he was $\underline{ 2 }$ middle school student, Zhu often did exercise. Because he worked very hard and got good scores, he $\underline{ 3 }$ enter the National University of Defense Technology in Changsha in the summer of 2005 and remained there for the following years. In 2015, Zhu graduated from the university and took $\underline{ 4 }$ first engineering job. In 2018, Zhu heard about the selection ï¼ˆé€‰æ‹”ï¼‰ of China's third-generation astronauts. He decided $\underline{ 5 }$ a try. In September 2020, Zhu $\underline{ 6 }$ joined the group of eighteen astronauts, including six $\underline{ 7 }$ flight engineers. However, for an engineer who had no air flight experience, the training tasks were really difficult. For example, and they had to do many tests on a computer. That needed great perseverance ï¼ˆæ¯…åŠ›ï¼‰. Zhu completed the hard training himself $\underline{ 8 }$ he also played a role in $\underline{ 9 }$ the team relaxed and helping others in his team stay clear-headed by singing and telling jokes. Last year, all his hard work paid off ï¼ˆå¾—åˆ°å›æŠ¥ï¼‰ $\underline{ 10 }$ he was chosen to carry out the Shenzhou XVI mission.
